column1: #Text=[0300]The compound of Example 65 (3.07 g) was dissolved in dichloromethane (40 mL) in an argon atmosphere.
#Text=C., borane tribromide (17.6 mL, 1.0 mol/mL dichloromethane solution) was added and the mixture was stirred for 26 hours at 0.degree.
#Text=Subsequently, the reaction was terminated by adding water and the mixture was extracted three times with ethylacetate.
#Text=The organic layer was washed with saturated brine and dried over sodium sulfate.
#Text=The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure to afford the title compound as a yellow powder (2.91 g).
